statement: You are given a int[] data. All elements in data are distinct. Only consecutive pairs of elements in data can be swapped. You are allowed to perform at most nSwaps swaps. Return the lexicographically maximal possible result.

notes.val: Given two int[]s  and  of equal length,  is lexicographically greater than  if an index  (0 <=  < ) exists such that [0] = [0], [1] = [1], ..., [ - 1] = [ - 1] and [i] > [i], where  is the size of .

examples.note: First, swap the third and fourth elements, and then, swap the first and second elements.

constraints.val: data will contain between 1 and 50 elements, inclusive.
Each element in data will be between 1 and 1000000, inclusive.
All elements in data will be distinct.
nSwaps will be between 0 and 1000000, inclusive.
